issue.title: [C++][Docs] Research Documentation Formats
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-17170](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
In order to revise the documentation, some inspiration is needed to get the format right. This ticket provides a space for exploration of possible inspiration for the C++ documentation – once we have some good examples and/or agreement, we can move to some content creation.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17569627) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
First potential reference for format, from previous conversation: <https://docs.dask.org/en/stable/>

Structure allows some iterative work – once a "getting started" section is made, then the "fundamentals" section could be created, with something like "internals" or "advanced" describing most of what we currently have.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17569631) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
<https://pandas.pydata.org/docs/>

While, since the current goal is to change only C++'s docs, we can't perfectly match this four-tile setup, this also provides a potential reference, and one that shouldn't be _too_ difficult to move to, as we already have an API reference and pieces of Getting Started and User Guide, and could, as above, flesh out a stronger Getting Started section and use what we have so far as the foundations of a User Guide.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17569635) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
<https://diataxis.fr/>

If we want something that's more directly a framework description, rather than strictly inspiration, Diataxis and further discussions surrounding that can provide guidance.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17569644) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
<https://jsvine.github.io/intro-to-visidata/#>

A harder example to pivot to with our current structure, since some articles would need to be split, but a convincing one for a library with a lot of information that may be best built up slowly.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17569733) by Aldrin Montana (octalene):*
I also like the rust book format: <https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/book/>

which uses `mdbook`: <https://github.com/rust-lang/mdBook>

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17170?focusedCommentId=17577580) by Kae Suarez (ksuarez):*
We have plenty of sources, and are moving forward with the Getting Started page currently.
